text:
Two elements declared with identical syntax each declare
a required attribute. The attribute is successfully recognized
for one element but not for the other; instead, an exception
is thrown.
[Xalan/Xerces versions as supplied for JWSDP-1.0_EA2,
 no other version information available.]
creator: cburke@mitre.org

text:
I think you want to report this against Xerces rather than Xalan... especially 
since I don't think Xalan turns on schema validation when it instantiates copies 
of Xerces. (We'll probably need to do so in the future, to support XPath2/XSLT2, 
but that's not today's code.)

You should also provide more details about exactly what commands you're 
invoking, with what input files, to provide the problem.
creator: keshlam@us.ibm.com
cburke@mitre.org
text:
Problem turns out to be loss of synchronization between
DTD and schema. Since both are required by your XML suite
in order to perform validation, they must agree.
[That is a longer-term problem that must be corrected,
but for now I can work around it.]
